subject: Real Estate
title: The Stuy Town Disaster
description: A 60-second lesson on The Stuy Town Disaster.

hook.text: In 2006, Tishman Speyer bought Stuyvesant Town in NYC for $5.4 billion. It was the biggest U.S. property deal.

buildup.text: The plan: convert rent-regulated apartments to market rate and multiply rental income.

discovery.text: Courts ruled the conversions illegal. The expected rental increases would never materialize.

twist.text: When the 2008 crash hit, the property's value collapsed. Tishman defaulted on $4.4 billion in loans.

climax.text: The deal became the largest real estate failure in U.S. history â€” a cautionary tale in overleveraged ambition.

punchline.text: The biggest deal became the biggest default.

quiz.question: Why did the Stuyvesant Town deal fail?
options: Courts blocked rent conversions, then the market crashed
